snippet: People infected with one strain of the dengue virus gain protection against the other three types for about two years, a study shows.
abstract: Derek A T Cummings study in The Journal of the Royal Society Interface finds that infection with one strain of dengue virus gives affected person protection against other three strains for about two years; information should help researchers to develop vaccines against the virus.
lead_paragraph: People infected with one strain of the dengue virus gain protection against the other three types for about two years, a study shows.

headline.main: Understanding the Protective Side of Dengue Virus

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Journal of the Royal Society Interface
